title: EXCLUSIVE: 'Scrubs' Star John C. McGinley Is a Fighter. His Son with Down Syndrome Is His Favorite Cause
summary: Actor John McGinley, Dr. Perry Cox on “Scrubs,”  describes life with his three kids: his oldest son Max, who has Down syndrome, and his teenage daughters.
story: As Dr. Perry Cox on “Scrubs,” John McGinley exhibited a hard-to-match intensity. In real life, that intensity comes out in his fierce devotion to his three kids, the oldest of whom was born with Down syndrome.
"It was like getting hit with a cosmic hammer," McGinley says of son Max's diagnosis at birth, on a video call with TODAY.com.

"Max was going to be a girl. Everything was all squared away. He showed up, and his 21st chromosome had tripled, he had heart issues and sleep apnea and some digestive tract problems, and I just shut down."

The year after Max’s birth was a roller coaster for McGinley and his ex-wife, Lauren Lambert. Adjusting to their new reality and keeping an eye on the heart condition Max was born with (which ultimately resolved itself) took some time, so McGinley stepped back from acting to focus on his family.

"It was time to circle the wagons and everything else had to wait," he says. "Since then, he has has grown into this lovely, lovely, stubborn, very opinionated young man who absolutely loves his sisters."
Raising Three Kids
Eventually, McGinley married his current wife, Nichole McGinley. In addition to Max, now 28, the couple raised their daughters Billie Grace, 17, and Kate, 15.
The girls are "so, so profoundly verbal, and that’s Maxie's biggest challenge," McGinley shares. In fact, that Kate plans to graduate high school two years early.
"It was a real focus to empower both of them, you know. Not put a wet blanket on Kate and Billy Grace being verbal, but still trying to empower Max to create as much language as he can," he says.
Balancing the very different needs of all three children can require a good deal of finesse, but the actor hasn't noticed any conflict between the three.

"I never wanted Max to be a burden to his two sisters. I wanted them to be the instigators or the initiators of activities done with their brother," McGinley explains. "They've treated Max as the biggest gift in the history of the planet, and it's shaped the way they see the world."
He emphasizes that “the way the girls treat their brother and have integrated Max into their lives, it’s the stuff of a parent’s dreams.”
Swinging For the Fences
Like many of the characters McGinley plays, he tends to think big.
His son loves swings, so McGinley made him some really big swings.
"You know that juice you're looking for when you're on the top arc of a swing? Max, he craves it," says McGinley, who refers to that "juice" as "vestibular stimulation."

When Max outgrew the playground swings, McGinley built something taller. He had giant swings constructed out of 25-foot telephone poles. McGinley says with a laugh, "They're ridiculous but they've yielded dividends."

In addition to swinging, Max loves to strum. He plays rhythm guitar for a band called Spec Labs. The band's name is derived from the fact that all of its musicians are on the spectrum in some capacity.
"Watching that evolution has been incredible because he used to play with his back to the audience, but eventually he turned around and played in front of the audience," McGinley says.
McGinley's Advocacy

McGinley cheers for his son in private but also advocates for him on a larger stage. He has been a staunch advocate for the GLOBAL Down Syndrome Foundation for years, primarily due to its focus on research and lobbying to ensure that every person with Down syndrome has an equitable chance at a satisfying life.

“This is going to sound a little crass, but I don’t want to be with a pamphlet-driven group,” McGinley says with Dr. Cox intensity. He wanted to support an organization that will create real, lasting change, and he believes GLOBAL will do just that.

As part of October's Down Syndrome Awareness Month, McGinley will take part in GLOBAL's "Be Beautiful, Be Yourself" fashion show, which is the largest fundraiser for Down syndrome in the world. He'll be one of the celebrity escorts helping models with Down syndrome rock the runway.
The Return of Dr. Cox
He will also be heading to Vancouver to film the "Scrubs" reboot, along with Zach Braff, Donald Faison and Sarah Chalke.

"I know we're shooting in Vancouver, and that's all I know, because I haven't seen a word of text," McGinley jokes while holding up his travel paperwork. "But it doesn't matter, Billy Lawrence is doing it. It's going to be great!"
In fact, McGinley asked series creator Lawrence to add a storyline with a special needs patient. And in Season 8, he did.
"It was great to put someone, a young adult born with Down syndrome on the show. He crushed it, and he crushed Dr. Cox and it was a great episode," McGinley recalls.

title: Molly Ringwald and Daughter Mathilda Make Rare Public Appearance Together
summary: Molly Ringwald's 21-year-old daughter, Mathilda Gianopoulos, made a rare red carpet appearance with her mom at the New York premiere of "Monster: The Ed Gein Story."
story: Molly Ringwald's 21-year-old daughter, Mathilda Gianopoulos, walked the red carpet with her at the New York City premiere of "Monster: The Ed Gein Story."

The duo stepped out together on Sept. 30 in two gorgeous outfits. Ringwald donned a white satin shirt, pleated pleather skirt and a pair of gold heels. As for Gianopoulos, she wore a beautiful white satin dress and a pair of pink ballet slippers.
Ringwald, who appeared in "Monster: The Jeffrey Dahmer Story" as Shari Dahmer in 2022, was seen posing alongside her kid side by side on the red carpet.

Ringwald also shared pictures of their rare outing on social media. On Instagram, she shared two snaps of Gianopoulos posing in her outfit and another of her daughter sitting across from her at a table.
She captioned the pics, "My date and my ♥️#daughter," adding the hashtags #firstborn and #bettedaviseyes.
Ringwald shares Gianopoulos and her 16-year-old twins, Roman and Adele, with her husband, Panio Gianopoulos.

Like Ringwald, Gianopoulos has also taken an interest in acting. In 2024, she appeared in director Michael Showalter's film "The Idea of You." During a 2023 interview with People, Ringwald told the outlet how she feels about her daughter becoming an actor.
She said it's "something that we thought a lot about. She learned how to do it before but it’s a hard job and I think she knows what she’s in for.”
When asked how her mom prepared her for the role, Gianopoulos told the outlet that Ringwald gave her tips about "everything" she needed to know.
“Be prepared to wait and be nice, which you should always be anyways," she said of what her mother told her.
Ringwald added, “Remember people’s names."

Ringwald, who's known for films like "The Breakfast Club" and "Sixteen Candles," once told Andy Cohen that she fears watching her older movies with her kids because of the controversial elements in the films.

“My 12-year-old daughter Adele is the most woke individual that you’ve ever met, and I just don’t know how I’m going to go through that, you know, watching it with her and (her) saying, ‘How could you do that? How could you be part of something that—'" she said on SiriusXM's Radio Andy in 2021.

title: Selena Gomez's Engagement and Wedding Rings Analyzed by Jewelry Pros
summary: What are the details behind Selena Gomez's engagement ring? How big is it? How much did it cost? Find out all the details here.
story: Selena Gomez is now a married woman, and has the diamonds to show it.
On Saturday, Sept. 27, the “Only Murders in the Building” actor married longtime friend-turned-partner Benny Blanco, with both showing off moments from the California nuptials on social media.
Among a series of photos from the big day, Blanco shared a close-up shot of his hand under Gomez’s, giving a detailed image of her engagement ring, their wedding bands and his own diamond jewelry.
After Blanco proposed to Gomez in December 2024, the actor had the internet swooning over her engagement ring, which she called the “diamond I’ve always dreamed of” in a later interview.
Based on Blanco’s photo, she paired the engagement ring with diamond wedding band. Here’s what we know about Gomez’s engagement ring.
What does Selena Gomez’s engagement ring look like?
Gomez first showed off her engagement ring, which has a marquise-cut center stone and an infinity band, in December 2024.
Jeweler Simone Kendle, CEO of Wove, tells TODAY.com the ring is "diamond-forward" because of the "slightly thicker" band set with round diamonds.
"It’s a bold departure from the daintier bands we often see. It’s a statement of strength and radiance all at once," Kendle says.
Speaking to Interview Magazine, Gomez and Blanco said the ring initially had more bling — until Gomez changed her mind.
“It used to have huge baguettes on the side and then she was like, ‘I don’t want something that big,’” he said.
Gomez added, “I just think it’s too much.”
Those extra gemstones aren’t going to waste, however. In that interview, Blanco said they’ll use the extra baguettes to make earrings, adding Gomez “basically has three wedding rings.”
How many carats is Selena Gomez's wedding ring?
While Gomez has never confirmed the size of her engagement ring, jewelers have estimates.
Gemstone wholesaler Julia Hackman Chafé estimated the center stone is four carats with .25 carat stones lining the band.
Kendle, CEO of the jewelery brand Wove, estimated the ring is between three and four carats.
How much does Selena Gomez's wedding ring cost?
Gomez and Blanco have never confirmed the price, either, but Kendle placed the ring in the "$200,000 to $300,000 range," once the center stone is paired with the setting.
Scott Grimes, Designer of Christian James Jewelry, estimated the ring cost between $200,000 and $350,000.
The meaning behind the marquise diamond
The ring’s center stone seemed to nod to her 2015 collab with A$AP Rocky, “Good for You.’
In the same conversation with Interview Magazine, Gomez explained the marquise diamond was inspired by her previous music, as fans speculated.
“Ever since the ‘Good for You’ days — that was, gosh, so many years ago — that’s the diamond I’ve always dreamed of,” she said, showing off her ring.
In the song, Gomez, sings, “I’m in my marquise diamonds /I’m a marquise diamond /Could even make that Tiffany jealous.”

Referencing the song post-engagement, Blanco shared a social media video clinking champagne glasses with Gomez set to “Good for You,” specifically highlighting the line she sings about “marquise diamonds.”

title: Cillian Murphy Explains His Disinterested Expression — and Why It Serves Him as an Actor
summary: Cillian Murphy weighed in on why he thinks it's important for actors to be known for their work and not necessarily their personality
story: Cillian Murphy weighed in on why he thinks it's important for actors to be known for their work and not necessarily their personality.
In a preview clip for the Oct. 5 "Sunday Sitdown With Willie Geist," the Academy Award-winning actor spoke with Sunday TODAY anchor about why he doesn't seem too interested in becoming a celebrity.

"One of the things I admire about you, Cillian, is your complete disinterest in being a celebrity or a movie star," Willie said while laughing. "And that you’re an actor and you wanna be known for your work, and you’ve pulled that off."
Willie then asked Murphy why it was important for people not to know too much about him personally.

"I’ve always felt that if you wanna try and inhabit somebody convincingly that it seems sensible that there wouldn’t be too much — that people wouldn’t have an impression of you as an individual that would in some way inhibit your ability to do that," Murphy said.

"That’s kind of what I’ve always felt," he continued. "I like the transformative nature of acting. So if you can kinda keep that as background, then I think it allows you more freedom as a performer, you know?"

Murphy made a name for himself in roles like Christopher Nolan's  "Batman Begins" and "Inception," and the popular series "Peaky Blinders." When he landed the role of J. Robert Oppenheimer in Nolan's epic film, "Oppenheimer," he not took home an Oscar, but also became more of a household name.
The three-hour film won seven Oscars, including the Academy Award for best picture and Murphy's Oscar for best actor in a leading role.

Since the release of "Oppenheimer," Murphy has gone on to star in the Zombie movie, "28 Days Later," and "Small Things Like These," a film adaptation of Irish author Claire Keegan's book of the same name.

That film follows an Irish father in the 1980s as he discovers abuse occurring at a local convent's Magdalene Laundry. At laundries across the country, "fallen women" were forced into unpaid labor until the last laundry closed in 1996, according to the BBC.
Murphy described learning of the scandal as a "collective trauma for people of a certain age" at a 2024 press conference, according to the Guardian.

“I think the irony of the book is that it’s a Christian man trying to act Christian in a dysfunctional Christian society. And it asks a lot of questions about publicity and silence and shame, all of those things,” Murphy said. “But I really don’t think the duty of art is to answer those questions, it’s to talk to them. And maybe it’s easier to absorb than an academic report, or a political report.”
Murphy's newest role is in Netflix's "Steve," in which he portrays the titular role of a headteacher at a school for boys with societal and behavioral issues. "Steve" is set to premiere on Oct. 3.

title: 'Love Is Blind' Star Blake Anderson Explains Why He Abruptly Left the Show: EXCLUSIVE
summary: Blake Anderson explains why he left the Love Is Blind Season 9 despite having connections with multiple women.
story: “Love Is Blind” Season 9 is here and already viewers have seen an unprecedented amount of contestants quit the show compared to past seasons.
The ninth season of the hit Netflix reality dating show arrived on Oct. 1 with six episodes that introduced fans to 32 Denver singles hoping to add to the dating experiment’s success rate.
But while watching the love stories develop, fans suddenly learned that a whopping four contestants had exited the show, all of whom were heavily featured up until that point.

One of those contestants was Blake Anderson, a 34-year-old accountant who formed strong connections with Anna Yuan and Megan Walerius. However, in the first unexpected departure of the season, a message appeared in Episode 3 explaining that Yuan chose to leave the show. Anderson seemed stunned when a producer informs him about Yuan’s abrupt exit.
Later in the same episode, titled “Ghost Town,” Anderson was supposed to meet Walerius in the pods for a date. But he never showed. Another message updated viewers that he quit the show, as well.
In an interview with TODAY.com, Anderson revealed why he dropped out of the experiment and also shared if he has any regrets.
Anderson says that although his departure seemed hasty, he actually had doubts throughout the pod process. The accountant explains that the show’s timeline didn’t match his feelings.
“I think going into the experiment, everyone is keenly aware of the condensed timeline, and I certainly was as well,” he says. “But you go in optimistic.”
He shares that the first day of the pods stage is a “speed dating type of day” where all the contestants have lighthearted, fun dates with each other.

“But I think I always had that timeline in the back of my mind. So as the days kind of ticked by, and I think we were probably midway through the experiment or so, I felt like a proposal probably wasn’t in the cards for me,” he continues.
It wasn’t just his intuition telling him that he should walk away if he wasn’t ready to get down on one knee.

“It was communicated throughout the entire experiment (that) if you weren’t there working towards an engagement, you probably shouldn’t be there. So I thought the best thing for me to do was to remove myself from the experiment,” he says.

Also in Episode 3, viewers saw a disappointed Walerius sit in a pod alone before she realized Anderson wasn’t coming. She told the cameras she had been “stood up” by Anderson before tearfully adding that he could’ve at least shown up to explain himself.
While chatting with TODAY.com, Anderson acknowledges that his exit was “a little bit clumsy.”

“(I) certainly didn’t intend to leave anyone hanging,” he says. “The departure was maybe a little bit clumsy on my part. I didn’t think it through, but I truly thought in the moment I was doing the right thing.”
Since Anderson quit shortly after Yuan left, some might speculate that that is what convinced him to leave. But he says that wasn’t what happened.

“I think I was more so kind of concerned with how I was feeling. The timeline was just a hurdle that I couldn’t get over. I think at that point you only have so many days left before you’re kind of faced with that, ‘Hey, should I propose? Should I not?’ I felt like I was nowhere close to that with any of my connections,” he explains.
Still, he says he would change how he handled the situation despite making “the right decision at the time.”
“In hindsight, yes, I think hearing about how everything went down upon my departure, certainly I own that I was definitely clumsy on my part, and I should have thought that through,” he shares.

Anderson adds, “But it truly wasn’t on my radar, that that would be a possibility, and so I didn’t run through that scenario. Certainly, if I had, I would have stuck around and had those conversations.”

In addition to Anderson and Yuan, Episode 6 began with engaged couple Patrick Suzuki and Kacie Mcintosh choosing not to continue with the experiment after Mcintosh privately reveals to producers she wasn’t attracted to her fiancé.
While Anderson and Mcintosh are not shown in the teaser clip for the next group of Season 9 episodes, Yuan and Suzuki are seen reuniting to discuss the connection they also built in the pods.
Viewers will have to tune in next week when the episodes are released on Oct. 8 to see how the confrontation unfolds.

title: 'Platonic' Creators Break Down the Season 2 Ending and Writing as a Married Couple: EXCLUSIVE
summary: What happens to Sylvia and Will in the ending of Platonic Season 2? Here's the ending of the show explained by creators Francesca Delbanco and Nicholas Stoller.
story: Warning: This post contains spoilers for Season 2 of "Platonic."
It’s official: As of the "Platonic" Season 2 finale, Sylvia (Rose Byrne) and Will (Seth Rogen) are changing their friendship status to business partners.

Co-created, directed and written by married couple Nicholas Stoller and Francesca Delbanco, “Platonic” follows two former college friends now in their 40s as they help one another navigate their messy midlife eras. After a long estrangement, Sylvia and Will reunited in Season 1. In Season 2, they weather new changes.
Delbanco, who was a novelist prior to becoming a screenwriter, wanted "Platonic" to explore questions around what a fulfilled life really entails.

“It is possible to love your life and still look around and think, ‘This is it?’" Delbanco says. “The path of adulthood is, by necessity, about closing doors to things that you might have also liked to do. It doesn’t mean you don’t like the choices you made. It means you miss having a choice.”
"The path of adulthood is, by necessity, about closing doors to things that you might have  also liked to do. It doesn’t mean you don’t like the choices you made. It means you miss having a choice."
Francesca Delbanco
This middle-aged angst is where comedy and drama become one.

“We always start with asking ourselves, ‘What is the emotional story we’re telling?’ because when you’re honest, that’s what’s funniest,” says Stoller, who worked on comedy films like “Forgetting Sarah Marshall,” “The Muppets,” and “Neighbors.”

While Season 1 ended with Will’s engagement to his Johnny 66 boss Jenna (Rachel Rosenbloom), the new season picks up with an indecisive Will questioning if his happily ever after should include Jenna. Spoiler alert: It doesn’t. But don’t worry, she can always look into her father’s ruptured eye and be reminded of Will. (The disaster that is episode “Fore!” will make you think twice about hitting the green.)

With nowhere else to go, Will ends up living in Sylvia’s standalone dwelling unit, which only accentuates their different lifestyles. But what keeps this bickering, yet inseparable friendship alive is they keep each other accountable, holding a mirror up against one another.

“They can be truth tellers toward each other and can call each other out on their shit,” Stoller says. Delbanco explains these friends can outright tell each other, “You’re annoying me” or “Shut up,” which offers a fun dynamic to explore.

After an embarrassing loss on "Jeopardy!", Sylvia’s husband, Charlie (Luke Macfarlane), quits his law firm in pursuit of writing a novel. Irritated he left their family in financial instability, Sylvia avoids reading his manuscript by kayaking the Los Angeles River with Will and her friend Katie (Carla Gallo). While Will and Katie enjoy splashing around in the contaminated waters, Sylvia finds it difficult to appreciate the beauty of seagulls.

When Sylvia finally forces herself to read the legal adventures of “Brett Coyote,” Sylvia discovers Will had encouraged Charlie to leave his job. As a result, Sylvia tells Will to move out and accepts a full-time job as an in-house event planner for a production company with a boss who loves to call everyone “b---h” (Aidy Bryant).
So where does that leave us in the season finale?
While Sylvia struggles with nonstop travel for work, Charlie suffers from writer’s block. (Byrne’s real-life partner Bobby Cannavale guest stars as Charlie’s protagonist in imagined sequences.)

During an emotional goodbye to their 2012 Honda Odyssey, Sylvia motivates Charlie to keep writing and even organizes a book release party for “Brett Coyote.” At his book launch, Charlie tells his friend and coworker, Stewart (Guy Branum), he misses work and wants to return to law.

Upon finding out Jenna issued a revengeful noncompete, halting the opening of Will’s new bar, Sylvia comforts Will and urges him to keep his business dreams alive. When Charlie and Stewart inform them the only way around a noncompete is to have someone else be the face of the company, Sylvia raises her hand.
For Stoller and Delbanco, this was not the first time they thought of mixing friendship and business on "Platonic."
“We tried to do it this season over a few episodes and even in the first season, but it’s such a massive plot point that we realized this is not an episode idea, but a season idea,” Stoller says.
Starting a business will not only be prime for numerous comedic fights in a potential Season 3, which is not yet confirmed, but also serve as a practical tool for storytelling.

“As much as we would all love to hang out with our friends, it doesn’t dovetail with the life of an adult in their midlife. This way, it gives Sylvia and Will an excuse to be together all day, every day,” Delbanco says.
As for the real-life married duo? Stoller and Delbanco find working together to be much more effortless than Sylvia and Will.

“We share a tone much more than I thought,” Stoller says. “It’s rare that we disagree. But I know if Francesca doesn’t like something, it probably won’t work. She has a rare, keen instinct as to whether something is going to work both emotionally and comedically.”
Even on what feels like the longest day, what Delbanco appreciates most is how Stoller excels at keeping the energy up in the writers’ room.

“I am lucky to get to experience it in my normal life when we’re all having breakfast together,” Delbanco says. “But seeing it in a professional context, I am reminded of how powerful it is to make a room full of exhausted people laugh.”

title: Tom Brady Reacts to How Travis Kelce Is Juggling His Football Career and Personal Life
summary: Tom Brady tells TODAY.com the advice he would give to Travis Kelce as he juggles his engagement with Taylor Swift and the start of a new NFL season on the Kansas City Chiefs.
story: Tom Brady, who cemented his legacy as an all-time great quarterback after playing in the NFL for 23 years, knows that life doesn’t stop happening just because football season is underway.
So, does the seven-time Super Bowl champion have any life advice for Travis Kelce, who revealed he and Taylor Swift got engaged about a week before the NFL season began?

While talking about his recent ad campaign with Hertz, which highlights the brand’s new online car-buying platform that sells used cars, Brady shares comforting words to pass along to Kelce when it comes to juggling his personal and professional lives.
“It’s all part of growing up,” the quarterback-turned-analyst tells TODAY.com.

During his NFL run from 2000 to 2023, Brady won six Super Bowls as part of the New England Patriots dynasty and one ring as a Tampa Bay Buccaneer. In that same era, he also became a dad to his three children, underwent a public engagement, marriage and divorce and handled what is best described as unprecedented fame.

Kelce is seen as a key player of the ongoing Chiefs dynasty, with the team winning the Vince Lombardi Trophy in 2020, 2023 and 2024. But his fame reached exponential heights after Swift attended her first Chiefs game in September 2023, fueling already-existing romance rumors.
From there, the pair began discussing their relationship publicly  and on Aug. 26, 2025, they shared their engagement news on Instagram, which has since amassed over 37 million likes.

But the happy moment comes off the heels of a major loss for the Chiefs in Super Bowl 59, when they attempted to make history with their third consecutive championship win but fell short against the Philadelphia Eagles.
That doesn’t seem to faze Brady, who is currently the lead NFL analyst at Fox Sports and a minority owner of the Las Vegas Raiders, when it comes to Kelce’s track record.
“I really think Travis is a great player. I’ve gotten a chance to cover him a lot,” Brady shares. “He’s going to go into the Hall of Fame as one of the great tight ends. I enjoy covering him.”
"Seems like things are going great," he adds, alluding to Kelce's career and love life.
Outside of Brady's work in the NFL and his new ad with Hertz, the 48-year-old is gearing up to play in the Fanatics Flag Football Classic at Kingdom Arena in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, on March 21, 2026.

After news broke in September that Brady would be partaking in the tournament, fans and media outlets alike said this marked him coming out of retirement once again. However, Brady uses another term to mark the occasion.
“It’s not like I ever played flag football before, so I’m not technically unretiring to play. It’s kind of like a new initiative,” the broadcaster explains.

“But what I’ve always loved about football is throwing the ball and connecting with my teammates and this would just be a really fun day to be a part of, and I think it’s going to be just a terrific event," he adds.

title: Selena Gomez's Wedding Dresses Analyzed by Pros: 'Homegrown Elegance'
summary: What were Selena Gomez's wedding dresses? Experts explain her fashion choices and what they might mean. HEre are photos of the two wedding dresses.
story: Selena Gomez married music producer Benny Blanco over the weekend, donning at least two timeless looks.
The “Only Murders in the Building” actor, whom Blanco called a “real life Disney princess,” shared photos of the Ralph Lauren looks she wore for the Sept. 27 wedding.
Below, wedding industry experts break down the messages Gomez's dresses are sending. Here's a closer look at both looks — and why she might have chosen them.
Dress No. 1

Gomez's first wedding dress, which she shared in an Instagram post, was a satin gown with a halter neckline finished with embroidery and 3D florals. Per a statement from Ralph Lauren, this was worn "for the wedding."

Ralph Lauren described the dress as a "double-faced silk satin dress, featuring hand-draped panels" and a halter neckline "highlighted with hand-cut lace and a delicate macramé collar, further enhanced by multi-dimensional embroidery."
Gomez paired the dress with a lily-of-the-valley bouquet and 12-carat diamond earrings by Tiffany & Co.
Wedding gown designer Hayley Paige tells TODAY.com that Gomez’s first look “exuded softness, touched with old-Hollywood romance.” The bouquet choice “evoked an effortless, cinematic grace.”

While Gomez has not revealed an inspiration behind her looks, Mignonette Bridal founder Kpoene Kofi Bruce relates the first dress’ silhouette and "dramatic plunging back” to the style of 1940s actor Rita Hayworth.
“It is a refreshing take after years of strapless ballgowns or slinky bias-cut slips,” she adds. Her hair, styled in a short bob with sweeping ends, also evokes old Hollywood.
Dress No. 2
Blanco was the first to share photos of Gomez's second bridal look. It was another halter neck gown designed by Ralph Lauren, this time made out of lace.

Ralph Lauren said the dress features "300 hand-shaped and applied lace flowers" and an embroidered design that took over 200 hours to create. There's a hidden detail, too: The couples' initials and the wedding date are sewn into the dress.
By going from satin to lace, Danny Seo, publisher of BG: Bridal Guide Magazine, sees Gomez “(completing) the transformation from girl next door to grown-up icon.”
“Lace can easily veer into matronly territory if handled poorly, but here it felt fresh, youthful, and perfectly on point,” he continues.
Kristen Coke, founder of The Wedding Strategist and a cultural events content creator, thinks lace signals intimacy with her guests.
“Lace is more delicate, but there’s an intimacy there,” Coke says. “It feels like she’s like leaning into like that romance and vulnerability.”
Put them together, Paige says, and the two dresses tell a story of "duality."
“One leaned into quiet elegance, the other into celebratory sparkle, together forming a radiant bridal duet,” she says.
Dress No. 3
For the reception, Gomez went short. This time, she wore a dress with a "bodice of tulle, draped with hand-pleated and stitched panels of cotton, silk, and linen voiles," the designer said.
The effect was to "create an airy, elegant silhouette, while a tulle underskirt adds volume and movement."
Why Ralph Lauren?

This isn’t Ralph Lauren’s first bridal moment of the year — Gomez’s longtime friend Taylor Swift wore the designer in her engagement photos with fiancé Travis Kelce. The $398 silk halter dress Swift wore sold out in minutes.
Coke thinks the designer is sending a message for both Gomez and Swift.
“When you’re choosing your designer for your wedding dress, you’re choosing a partner in your storytelling,” she says.
She points out that while Lauren designs couture, the brand also has off-the-rack styles, making the designer one that bridges worlds.

“There’s a richness to Ralph Lauren that’s not about flash, it’s about legacy. These two billionaire superstar women choosing this subdued but elegant, accessible but elevated designer feels like the right note to hit,” she says.
Paige says Gomez added “a layer of classic romanticism and Americana" by wearing Ralph Lauren —  "a kind of homegrown elegance that feels both aspirational and relatable."

title: Fran Drescher Gets Walk of Fame Star With 'The Nanny' Co-Stars by Her Side
summary: Fran Drescher received a Hollywood Walk of Fame star on Sept. 30, joined by "The Nanny" co-stars Nicholle Tom and Madeline Zima.
story: Fran Drescher celebrated her 68th birthday with some of her co-stars from "The Nanny" at the ceremony for her new star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame on Sept. 30.

Drescher, who played Fran Fine on the sitcom, posed with her star surrounded by her stepdaughters on the show: Nicholle Tom, who played Margaret "Maggie" Sheffield, and Madeline Zima, who played Gracie Sheffield.
The trio posed for photos alongside Lisa Ann Walter at the ceremony, and Drescher gave a speech about the honor.

"The things you hear about Hollywood is all true. It's the land of dreams, but staying grounded and authentic is imperative," Drescher said. "Keeping old friends with you, close to you, and never forgetting where you came from is essential."
Drescher said that learning to love yourself, "regardless of rejection or praise," is important.
"We are very imperfect beings, learning and growing along the way through all the pitfalls and mistakes made," she said. "To do it right, we must make kindness and compassion our compass."

Drescher was nominated for two Golden Globes and two Emmy Awards for her role on "The Nanny," which she also co-created and executive produced. She has also starred in movies like "This Is Spinal Tap," "Doctor Detroit" and more, and is set to appear in the upcoming film "Marty Supreme" with Timothée Chalamet.
Tom and Zima also gave a joint speech for Drescher at the ceremony, with Tom calling Drescher "loud, strong, confident, colorful, kind."
"Fran, I love you. I’ve always looked up to you, even though I had to wear flats," Tom joked. "You are my mentor and I just love you. Congratulations!"
Zima said Drescher wasn't just a household name, clarifying that she is the household.

"She’s the glamorous aunt, the no-nonsense mom, the best friend who tells you when your outfit needs a little more leopard print, and the neighbor whose laugh you can hear through the drywall," Zima said.

"Today, we honor Fran for all she’s given us — the laughs, the glamour, the advocacy, the heart and the very real reminder that being loud, being proud and being yourself is the most powerful thing that you can be," she added.
Drescher's star is the 2,822nd star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame, according to the Hollywood Chamber of Commerce.

title: Woman Makes 'Wheel of Fortune' History with $1M Grand Prize Win — See Her Priceless Reaction
summary: Christina Derevjanik became the biggest winner ever on "Wheel of Fortune," after winning more than $1 million.
story: Christina Derevjanik can buy a lot more than just a vowel.

The woman, who is from Stamford, Connecticut, made game show history Sept. 30 when she won the most money ever on a single episode of “Wheel of Fortune." Her piled-up winnings totaled $1,035,155 after when she won the $1 million prize.

Derevjanik got off to something of a slow start, failing to win either of the two toss-ups to open the show. She caught a break, though, during the first puzzle when she landed on the $1 million wedge during a spin. She then landed on another wedge for a trip to Montana before solving the puzzle, which netted her a total of $10,556.
Derevjanik didn’t win the second puzzle, but she hit paydirt once more during the third puzzle, winning another $5,350, as well as a trip to Tokyo that boosted her total winning to $27,505.
She added another $2,000 during the triple toss-up and tacked $5,650 when she solved the fourth puzzle. She easily advanced to the bonus round with a total of $35,155.

The $1 million wedge was in play in the bonus round, as it replaced the $100,000 envelope. Before she played, Derevjanik shared her boss was with her at the taping and host Ryan Seacrest asked what she planned to do if she won the $1 million prize.
“I may be putting in my two weeks (notice), but we won’t tell her that yet,” she joked.
She spun the wheel, landed on the ampersand and easily solved the puzzle in the “Living Things” category: “Pack of coyotes.”
Seacrest then showed her the envelope from the ampersand, which said “One Million.” Confetti then rained down from the ceiling.
“You won a million dollars!” Seacrest exclaimed.
“You're shaking. I’m in tears,” he added as the audience wildly cheered. Derevjanik jumped up and down, hugging Seacrest and Vanna White.
“You’re a millionaire!” he said, while the audience continued applauding.
She then joked she and her boss “will have a discussion” when they get back to the office about her future plans, alluding to her earlier comment about quitting.
How many people have won the $1 million prize on “Wheel of Fortune”?
Derevjanik joined a very exclusive club, becoming just the fourth person to win the $1 million prize on "Wheel of Fortune." She is also the first to do so since Ryan Seacrest became host.

title: Robert Irwin Has Jaw-Dropping Shirtless 'DWTS' Moment: Watch His Dance
summary: Robert Irwin had the crowd going wild when he ripped off his shirt and flipped his partner, Witney Carson, in the air on "Dancing With the Stars."
story: Robert Irwin gave a show-stopping performance on TikTok Night of "Dancing With the Stars."
In the middle of his salsa with Witney Carson, Irwin, a wildlife conservationist, ripped off his shirt as he danced to Tommy Richman's hit song "Million Dollar Baby."
When Irwin's shirt came off, the fans in the audience went completely wild. They also cheered for him when he flipped Carson in the air. Their vibrant performance landed them a Week 3 score of 22/30.

Irwin, who previously tied for first place with “The Secret Lives of Mormon Wives” star Whitney Leavitt, came up a bit short for the top spot during this week of the competition. He was two points shy of getting the best score of the night, trailing behind Leavitt and Olympic gold medalist Jordan Chiles tied for first with a score of 24/30.

Meanwhile, “Fifth Harmony” singer Lauren Jauregui, received the lowest score this week when she performed a cha cha to her hit single "Work From Home" while three of her Fifth Harmony bandmates — Normani, Ally Brooke, and Dinah Jane — watched in the audience. Camila Cabello, who left the group in 2016, was not in attendance.
Due to her score, Jauregui was eliminated. When asked how she felt about going home, the singer said, “Pissed," and fans agreed.
"Lauren’s response to being eliminated was absolutely valid btw," one person commented on YouTube.

Another said, "Lauren’s elimination was beyond bulls---. she had every right to feel the way she felt. i’m glad that she didn’t sugar coat her answer when she was asked how she was feeling about her elimination. and i feel so horrible for brandon, they keep doing this to him every season."
As for Irwin, fans couldn't stop talking about his performance online.
"Went from 'ballroom' dancing to Magic Robert real quick once that shirt came off," a fan wrote on YouTube.
Another said, "Whatever the IT factor is...Robert has it!!! He exudes such confidence at the same time remaining so humble!"

title: EXCLUSIVE: NYC Townhouse Gets Magical ‘Wicked’ Makeover Ahead of Sequel
summary: A New York City townhouse is letting people step into the land of Oz with its “Wicked”-inspired renovation.
story: A New York City townhouse is letting people step into the land of Oz with its “Wicked”-inspired renovation.

Ahead of the release of “Wicked: For Good,” an NYC home was transformed to include home and lifestyle merchandise inspired by the Universal film. Fans in the area will get to immerse themselves in the walk-through experience for one day only.
Put on by Universal Products & Experiences, each room in the townhouse was decorated to reflect the spirit of “Wicked,” including green and pink decor in honor of Elphaba and Glinda.
A slew of products from all-new collaborations with brands like Stanley, Le Creuset, Voluspa, Pottery Barn, Owala, Gap, Roots and many more are on display all throughout the space.
Some fans of “Wicked” will be able to immerse themselves in the NYC townhouse during the Oct. 1 walk-through fan experience. The free ticketed Eventbrite event sold out immediately upon going live.
TODAY.com, however, has an exclusive look at the fully decorated townhouse, as well as some of the collaborations that are featured inside.
No corner is left untouched as clothing items, backpacks, glassware, candles and incense, chocolates, American Girl dolls and other toys all embrace the world of “Wicked.”
“Wicked: For Good” will see Cynthia Erivo’s Elphaba and Ariana Grande’s Glinda reunite and face off after the events of the first film.
In the final trailer, released exclusively on TODAY Sept. 24, Elphaba is seen flying over Oz and writing “Our Wizard Lies” in the clouds.

Elphaba confronts her old schoolmate, telling her she has “no real power,” as they figure out how to save their friendship amid their vast differences. It also gives a glimpse at Dorothy’s arrival with her companions, famously known as the Cowardly Lion, Tin Man and Scarecrow.
Included in the sequel are songs like “No Good Deed” and “For Good.”
“Wicked: For Good” arrives in theaters on Nov. 21.

title: Who Gets Engaged on 'Love Is Blind' Season 9? See the Full List
summary: Who gets engaged on 'Love Is Blind' Season 9? See a full list of the 2025 season set in Colorado.
story: The first six episodes of "Love Is Blind" Season 9 ends, of course, in a few engagements. But there are unexpected twists, too, including multiple early departures.

The Netflix dating series returned on Oct. 1 with a new set of singles based in Denver, Colorado. During the first batch of episodes, viewers watch participants make and break romantic connections in the dating pods.
Who ends up getting engaged? Read on for a recap of the Season 9 dating pods.
Ali and Anton
Ali, a 29-year-old nurse, and Anton, a 29-year-old who works in the transportation and logistics field, hit it off from day one.

In a confessional interview, Ali said she was looking for someone who matches her drive, especially since she's had to motivate her exes in the past. She described herself as "soft" and "nurturing" but admitted that she presents herself in a guarded way, perhaps to keep people away.

Once she started talking with Anton, Ali was surprised by how quickly they connected. They found common ground when they learned that they both speak multiple languages and first started learning English when they were 8 years old. Their connection deepened when they talked about their cultural backgrounds and upbringings.
Ali was first to declare her love, which inspired Anton to propose to her. When they met for the first time, sparks flew.
Madison and Joe

For Madison, a 28-year-old UX/UI designer, the "Love Is Blind" experiment was a case of art imitating reality. In the first episode, she explained that she has an eye condition that could make her go blind.

When Madison started talking with Joe, a 29-year-old who works in sales, she opened up about her condition. He took a moment to process the news, but reassured her that he would be willing to support her through thick and thin.

Joe got vulnerable while talking about his experience being engaged previously and explained that their love fell apart because they were too fundamentally different. Madison later told him he made her feel "so accepted and so loved."
Madison said "I love you" first, followed by Joe, and he soon proposed. After meeting, it took Joe a few minutes to connect the voice he heard in the pods to the person before him.
Annie and Nick
Nick, a 28-year-old luxury watch dealer, had a strong emotional connection with Kait, a 32-year-old registered dietitian, and quickly told her he thought she could be the one for him.
He was also talking to Annie, a 31-year-old hair salon owner. In a confessional interview, Nick referred to Annie as his "wildcard" and said he was curious to see where things go.
Annie was also talking to Brenden, a 32-year-old finance manager whom she called her "number one" because he was "dependable."
Over time, Annie told Nick he makes her feel "comfortable" and he said he will always fight for her. At the same time, he told Kait he was confident in their connection and that he loved her.

Things took a turn for Nick and Kait when they discussed the topic of religion. Nick is more connected to his faith than Kait, who said she struggled with believing in a higher power after watching her mother suffer from cancer for 10 years and die.

Annie told Nick she needed more validation from him since her connection with Brenden was so strong. The couple then had a deep conversation about parenting and sexuality. In her next date with Brenden, Annie was feeling the vibes and it looked as though the couple would progress to the next step in their relationship.

Nick told Kait he felt like he was being pulled in two different directions, and she didn't take it well, especially since he had told her he loves her. The conversation spiraled and Nick ended things with Kait.

Nick went all-in with Annie and told her he knew she was "the one." He said he loved her and she reciprocated. Annie had a long conversation with Brenden, who really wanted their relationship to work. However, she and Nick ended up getting engaged.
Megan and Jordan

When Jordan, a 30-year-old service manager, spoke with Megan, a 35-year-old entrepreneur, he initially wrote her off at her nickname: "Sparkle Megan." However, he changed his tune when he learned that she is smart and ambitious.

Jordan, a single father of a 5-year-old son, connected with Megan on a deeper level when he told her his son has Type 2 diabetes and learned that her late father also had the condition. Jordan revealed that he got a vasectomy after welcoming his son, but said he would reverse it if he and Megan decided they wanted to have additional children.

Despite her affection for Jordan, Megan wasn't sure that their lifestyles will fully mesh, especially since she had a connection with Mike, a 38-year-old real estate investor who seemed to match her drive for success.
Meanwhile, Megan was also falling for Blake, a 34-year-old accountant who also lost his father. However, Blake's number one connection was Anna, a 28-year-old hairstylist.
When Blake suddenly left the dating experiment, Megan was left to decide between Mike and Jordan. Mike seemed to match her more on a professional level, but her emotional connection with Jordan grew.
Despite Mike's attempts to convince Megan to fight for their relationship, he reminded her of her exes too much. She ultimately decided to go with Jordan and they get engaged.
Kalybriah and Edmond

Edmond, a 29-year-old realtor, instantly felt comfortable being vulnerable with Kalybriah, a 29-year-old social worker. He opened up about his experience growing up in the foster care system and was touched to learn that Kalybriah runs a nonprofit group home.
Edmond's larger-than-life personality and quirkiness were endearing to Kalybriah, and he was refreshed to hear that she has modern views on marriage and is ambitious about pursuing her career.
During one date, Kalybriah read Edmond a love letter she wrote for him. Afterwards, he proposed to her and she accepted.
Patrick and Kacie
Kacie, a 34-year-old hair and makeup artist, developed a connection with Patrick, a 31-year-old construction manager.

The duo spoke about ethnicity extensively in the dating pods. Kacie said her father once served a Mormon mission in Korea and her sister currently works as a singer in Korea. Patrick didn't reveal his ethnicity right away but alluded to it, saying that he's always struggled with being the only person of his ethnicity in his friend groups.

When Kacie pressed Patrick to share what his ethnicity, he hesitated, saying he doesn’t want to be “judged” for it, but then revealed that his parents are from South Asia. She reassured him that this changed nothing for her and explained that her siblings also date people from other ethnicities.

Patrick also had a connection with Anna, a Chinese woman who said she has mostly dated white men. They connected over the fact that their parents are from different countries and they both speak more than one language.

When Anna suddenly left the dating experiment, Patrick was left to explore his connection with Kacie. Their relationship sped up with sexual banter. However, Patrick questioned how much she really wanted him.
Patrick later proposed and they met in person.

Flash forward to the next episode and Kacie told producers she didn't believe that her attraction for Patrick would grow during the experiment. She then met with him and sent some confusing messages, making it seem as though she wanted to still date him, even though she told producers otherwise.

title: Lauren Jauregui Has 1-Word Blunt Response After Being Eliminated on 'DWTS'
summary: The singer did not appear to be happy after her name and "Dancing With the Stars" partner Brandon Armstrong were eliminated during the Sept. 30 episode.
story: Spoilers ahead for the Sept. 30 episode of “DWTS”
Lauren Jauregui did not expect to be the latest celebrity to be voted off “Dancing With the Stars.”

The Fifth Harmony singer and partner Brandon Armstrong were eliminated during Week 3 of “DWTS” on Sept. 30. The elimination happened after they performed a cha cha to Fifth Harmony's “Work From Home.”

After judges Carrie Ann Inaba, Bruno Tonioli and Derek Hough applauded and critiqued her routine, they gave her an 18 out of 30. That put her in the bottom of the leaderboard alongside Andy Richter and Emma Slater, who had the same score.
Proving just how vital audience and viewer votes are, both couples, as well as Elaine Hendrix and Alan Bersten, were the final three standing at the end of the episode.
When co-host Alfonso Ribeiro announced Jauregui and Armstrong as the couple eliminated, the others appeared surprised.
“You can hear from the audience that everybody is shocked,” co-host Julianne Hough said, before asking the singer how she was feeling.
“Pissed,” she said with a smile, as Armstrong laughed.
When asked how her experience with Armstrong had been, Jauregui replied, “Honestly, I’m so grateful to have you as a partner. Thank you so much.”
The camera also panned to her Fifth Harmony members Ally Brooke, Normani and Dinah Jane, who all appeared to be disappointed in the elimination.
As the credits rolled, Slater was seen running up to Armstrong, hugging him and saying, “I’m so sorry.”
Many others also gathered around Jauregui, including Richter who was seen embracing her. The comedian could be seen exchanging words with Jauregui as they hugged it out.
The competition is only expected to get more intense and emotional as it continues.
Another star is expected to be eliminated when “DWTS” returns with “Disney Night,” airing Tuesday, Oct. 7 at 8 p.m. on ABC.

title: 'Dancing With the Stars' Has Shocking Elimination After 'TikTok Night'
summary: "Dancing With the Stars" Week 3, Sept. 29, had the couples dance to "TikTok Night" themed dances. One couple got eliminated.
story: “TikTok Night” on “Dancing With the Stars” kicked off with a bang!
Week 3 of “DWTS” began with a tap opening number to “Apple” by Charli xcx that included Season 31 champion and TikToker Charli d’Amelio.

D'Amelio later returned with another dance with the troupe, dancing to “Savage” by Megan Thee Stallion, featuring choreography from pros Jenna Johnson and Britt Stewart and viral moves by Keke Janajah. She also danced with her former partner Mark Ballas to “Assumptions” by Sam Gellaitry.
Co-hosted by Alfonso Ribeiro and Julianne Hough, the 12 remaining couples made their way to the dance floor to give it their all.
Here’s a recap of what went down on the “DWTS” third episode, including the dances, scores from judges Carrie Ann Inaba, Bruno Tonioli and Derek Hough, and who was eliminated.

title: Taylor Swift's Mom Andrea Poses With Donna Kelce and Randi Mahomes In Sweet Mom's Pic
summary: Taylor Swift’s mom, Andrea Swift, made a rare social media appearance.
story: Taylor Swift’s mom, Andrea Swift, made a rare social media appearance.
Patrick Mahomes’ mom, Randi Mahomes, shared a photo that included the Swift matriarch and Travis Kelce’s mom, Donna Kelce.
The photo was featured in Randi Mahomes’ “Six pics to end September” Instagram story collage that she shared on Sept. 30.

Andrea Swift is in the middle, wearing a black top, gold necklaces and rocking a red lip like her famous daughter. Randi Mahomes opted for a white button-up vest top, while Donna Kelce was also seen in a black top.
The photo seems to be taken at Travis Kelce and Patrick Mahomes’ new steakhouse 1587 Prime in Kansas City.
Both Donna Kelce and Randi Mahomes are wearing the same tops in a Sept. 20 post that the latter shared on Instagram.
“Proud moms at @1587prime !! Starting our collection with these keepsakes now.. so blessed!” Randi Mahomes captioned the snap.
The steakhouse, which recently opened, includes a nod to Taylor Swift with its drink “The Alchemy,” which is the name of a song on the singer’s “The Tortured Poets Department” album.

Patrick Mahomes confirmed the connection during an interview with Kansas City’s “The Drive” radio show, saying, “Obviously, (we) wanted to have an ode to Taylor and how important she is, not only to us but to this city as well.”
As for the mom group pic, this appears to be one of the first photos of future-mother-in-laws Andrea Swift and Donna Kelce since their children, Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce, got engaged.
The couple announced their engagement in a joint Instagram post on Aug. 26.
“Your English teacher and your gym teacher are getting married,” they captioned the  slideshow.
Shortly after the announcement, Donna Kelce subtly celebrated the happy news by changing her Facebook cover photo to photos of her son and Taylor Swift as children.

title: Lola Young Updates Fans on Her Health After Onstage Collapse
summary: Lola Young is informing her fans that she is taking a break from music to focus on her health.
story: Lola Young is informing her fans that she is taking a break from music to focus on her health.
The British pop star posted a statement on Instagram Tuesday, Sept. 30 confirming that she is canceling all of her upcoming projects.
“I'm going away for a while,” she wrote. “It pains me to say I have to cancel everything for the foreseeable future.”
The 24-year-old singer thanked her fans for all their love and support before expressing her disappointment about being unable to perform.
She continued, “I’m so sorry to let anyone down who has bought a ticket to see me, it hurts me more than you know. Obviously you will be entitled to a full refund.”
Young ended her statement by sharing that she hopes to return to the stage in the future.
“I really hope you’ll give me a second chance once I’ve had some time to work on myself and come back stronger,” she concluded.
Her peers and fans supported her in the comments.
“Bless you!!!!!” singer JoJo wrote and added multiple red hearts.
Kehlani told Young, “You come first!!!”
“Queer Eye” star Tan France wrote, “Love that you’re taking the time you need to work on what’s best for you as a human, first and foremost. Sending so much positive energy your way!”
Chelsea Handler said, “Good for you.”
Young’s latest update came a few days after she collapsed mid-performance at a music festival in New York City.

The “Messy” singer performed at the All Things Go musical festival at Forest Hills Stadium on Saturday, Sept. 27. During her performance, Young played several songs, including her tracks “Wish You Were Dead” and “Spiders.”

While performing her song “Conceited,” fan videos on social media captured the singer gesturing to someone backstage and pointing to her head before she collapsed and fell backwards on-stage mid-performance.
Crew members from backstage immediately got on stage and surrounded Young before she was helped off the stage, as confirmed by TODAY.com.
Young addressed her health scare in an Instagram story several hours later, sharing a brief message for fans.
“Hi, For anyone who saw my set at all things go today , I am doing okay now,” the statement read. “Thank you for all of your support Lola xxx.”
She later returned to Instagram to announce that she would not take the stage for day three of the musical festival, which was held in D.C. on Sept. 28.

“I love this job and I never take my commitments and audience for granted," she said in a statement. “So I’m sorry to those who will be disappointed by this. I hope you’ll all give me another chance in the future. Thank you to all those who listen and care.”
She added, “To all the people that love to be mean online, pls give me a day off.”
Young had also canceled a performance the day prior on Friday, Sept. 26 at the Prudential Center in New Jersey.

Her manager, Nick Shymansky, shared a statement on her behalf on her Instagram story, which read in part, “Unfortunately due to a sensitive matter I have advised Lola Young to pull out of preforming at Audacy — We Can Survive @ Prudential Centre this evening.”

“Lola is very open about her mental health and there are very occasionally days where myself and my team have to take protective measures to keep her safe,” the statement continued. “She is an incredible person and always takes her fans, career and performance seriously. I can only send huge apologies for the inconvenience caused.”
Young addressed the show’s cancelation during her set at All Things Go, telling fans that she had “a tricky couple of days” leading up to the performance, per videos shared on social media.

“Sometimes life can really make you feel like you can’t continue,” Young said. “But you know what? Today I woke up and I made the decision to come here. I wanted to perform and I didn’t want to wallow in my sadness. Sometimes life can throw you lemons and you just have to motherf------ make lemonade.”
Young has been candid on social media and in interviews about her mental health throughout her career.

She opened up to The Telegraph in February 2022 about being diagnosed with schizoaffective disorder, a condition which displays symptoms of schizophrenia and a mood disorder, such as depression or bipolar disorder, when she was 17.  A September 2025 interview with Elle UK also confirmed that she had recently been diagnosed with severe attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder, commonly know as ADHD.
Following her on-stage collapse, other artists at All Things Go rallied around Young with messages of support for the singer.
Remi Wolf, who took the stage after Young, gave fans an update on how the singer was doing, per videos shared online.
Wolf shared, “I really quickly just wanted to say that my friend Lola is backstage and she’s okay. She’s getting good back here, so we’re all good, okay?”

Doechii, who closed out the show, called Young “an incredibly talented artist” during her set. The “Anxiety” singer explained that Young “wasn’t feel well tonight,” before adding, “I’m so glad that you guys were there to support her and hold her up.”
“Let’s wish her the best, everybody. We love you, Lola!” she added before leading the crowd in a supportive message for Young. “And I want her to hear that, and I want her to feel that.”

title: Bobbi Brown Shares Details From Kate Middleton's Wedding Makeup
summary: Kate Middleton didn't do her own wedding makeup has long had been rumored. Bobbi Brown explains that Hannah martin did Kate's makeup and she wore Bobbi Brown.
story: Though it's been rumored for years that Catherine, Princess of Wales, did her own makeup for her royal wedding to Prince William in April 2011, legendary makeup artist Bobbi Brown says that's not quite true.

Brown shared behind-the-scenes details about the former Kate Middleton's wedding day look — featuring a neutral lip color, pinkish blush and smoky eyes — in her new memoir, "Still Bobbi: A Master Class in Leading an Authentic Life."
Brown writes in the book, which was published earlier this month, that Kate "wore Bobbi Brown Cosmetics on her wedding day, and one of my makeup artists in England did her makeup."

"I was obsessed with the royal family," she writes, "so this was a huge honor, as well as evidence that my concept of beauty had impacted the world. It was hard to believe how far makeup had taken me."
Brown elaborated on Kate's wedding day makeup when she appeared on the Sept. 29 episode of the "Breaking Beauty" podcast.
"I did not do (Kate's) makeup. I wish I did," Brown said. "It was one of my artists, Hannah Martin, whose become quite a sensation in the U.K."
When one of the podcast's hosts pointed out that the media reported at the time that Kate did her own makeup, Brown responded, "No, Hannah did her makeup."
Brown said Martin hinted to her ahead of time that Kate would be walking down the aisle wearing Bobbi Brown Cosmetics.
"Hannah did give me some information that I should set my alarm and watch," Brown recalled. "We were texting back and forth and she's like, 'Oh my God, oh my God, oh my God.'"
Brown added that her company didn't acknowledge at the time that the then-Duchess of Cambridge was wearing their products because "no one did that back then."
"It wasn't the right thing to do," she explained.
But she does have a memento, of sorts, acknowledging her role in  the wedding.
"I did get a note, though, that I guess I have hanging in my office," said Brown, "not from Kate but from her person who wrote her letters saying how much she appreciated the makeup."

title: Nicole Kidman Files for Divorce from Keith Urban After 19 Years of Marriage
summary: Nicole Kidman has filed for divorce from Kieth Urban after 19 years of marriage, court records show.
story: Nicole Kidman has filed for divorce from Kieth Urban after 19 years of marriage, court records show.
According to documents from Davidson Court in Nashville, Tennessee, Kidman filed for divorce Sept. 30, citing “irreconcilable differences” between the couple.
The filing also requests that Kidman be named “primary residential parent” of her two children with Urban — Sunday, 17, and Faith, 14. Records show the two have agreed upon a parenting plan.
The actor is also mother to two adopted children — Isabella, 32, and Connor Cruise, 30 — from her first marriage to Tom Cruise.
TODAY.com has reached out to both Kidman and Urban for comment, has not yet received a response.
The documents were filed one day after TODAY learned of the couple's split.

Just months ago, Kidman celebrated her anniversary with Urban, whom she married in 2006, sharing a black-and-white photo of them cozying up to one another. She wrote on Instagram, "Happy Anniversary Baby," with a red heart emoji.
In a Aug. 19 Instagram post capturing "summer memories," Kidman posted a compilation of pictures and videos, none of which included the country singer.
While Kidman just wrapped filming "Practical Magic 2," per a Sept. 13 social media video, Urban has been sharing moments from his “High and Alive World Tour.”
In May, he posted smiling snaps with Kidman at the Academy of Country Music Awards, where he was honored with the Triple Crown Award.

In his acceptance speech, Urban showed his appreciation for his wife and daughters, telling Kidman, “I love you, baby girl.” (Kidman previously shared that "baby girl" is Urban's nickname for her — in addition to the name of a movie she starred in).
In 2005, the two met at a gala in Los Angeles. When recounting the meeting on “The Ellen DeGeneres Show” in 2017, Kidman said she had a “crush” on Urban, but that he “wasn’t interested” in her.
Meanwhile, during a 2018 appearance on the Australian show “Interview,” Urban said he was under the impression the actor “was way out of my league.”
“I might have a wild imagination of possibilities in life, obviously, but not in a million years did I think that somebody like that would be interested in me. At all,” he said at the time.
During a 2020 appearance on TODAY, Kidman told TODAY’s Jenna Bush Hager, “I’m married to a really good man.”

title: Jennifer Lawrence Unapologetically Declares She Is Team Jeremiah: 'Rake Me Over the Coals'
summary: Jennifer Lawrence revealed that she's Team Jeremiah out of the Fisher brothers in "The Summer I Turned Pretty" and explains her decision, calling Conrad Fisher "toxic."
story: Jennifer Lawrence has a hot take on the Fisher brothers in ”The Summer I Turned Pretty” and she isn’t backing down.
While promoting her new film “Die, My Love” in a Sept. 29 clip shared by Mubi,  the actor revealed that Jeremiah Fisher, the younger brother in the Prime Video series, has her support.
“I have been ordered by all of my friends to not reveal this,” she said while sitting alongside her co-star Robert Pattinson. "I’m Team Jeremiah, I am."

The show sees Isabel “Belly” Conklin (Lola Tung) in a love triangle with Jeremiah (Gavin Casalegno) and his older brother,  Conrad Fisher (Christopher Briney). While fans were mostly split during the first two seasons of the series, it was Season 3 that tipped the fandom scale toward Team Conrad.

In the final season, Conrad gained viewer favoritism for how he fought for Belly — even when she wasn't looking. Meanwhile, viewers criticized Jeremiah over his actions, resulting in the character gaining the infamous title of being “one of the internet’s most hated boyfriends,” per The New York Times.
However, that didn't hold Lawrence back from sharing her perspective.
"I think that Conrad is toxic, like, he kind of liked her but then he didn't and left her hanging," Lawrence said of the older Fisher brother, whom Belly chose in the series finale.
Pattinson stared at her with wide eyes as she continued on.

"And then for him to confess his love to her the night before her wedding is sick," she concluded, referring to Conrad telling Belly his feelings for her the night before she was going to marry Jeremiah.
Pattinson then told Lawrence that he hasn't seen "The Summer I Turned Pretty."
"I know I keep intending to watch the show," Pattinson said.
"I'm Team Jeremiah. Rake me over the coals," Lawrence concluded.

title: Who Is Tilly Norwood? Backlash to the AI-Generated Actor, Explained
summary: Who is Tilly Norwood? All about the AI generated actor sparkling controversy in Hollywood and what its creator had to say while defending it.
story: Tilly Norwood has become one of the most divisive actresses in Hollywood — and she's not even a human being.

The AI-generated actor was created by Eline Van der Velden, a Dutch actor and comedian who said at a tech event on Sept. 27 that a number of talent agents are interested in signing Norwood, according to Deadline.
The revelation by Van der Velden has sparked a backlash from Hollywood actors, directors and other creatives.
Here's what to know.
Who is Tilly Norwood?
The world's most controversial actor at the moment is an AI-generated creation of Xicoia, an artificial intelligence talent studio launched by Van der Velden.
The Dutch actor said at the Zurich Summit in Switzerland on Sept. 27 that companies are interested in using Norwood.

“We were in a lot of boardrooms around February time, and everyone was like, ‘No, this is nothing. It’s not going to happen’. Then, by May, people were like, ‘We need to do something with you guys.’ When we first launched Tilly, people were like, ‘What’s that?' and now we’re going to be announcing which agency is going to be representing her in the next few months,” Van der Velden said in her presentation, according to Deadline.
Van der Velden then compared her aspirations with the AI-generated actor to real-life actors.
“We want Tilly to be the next Scarlett Johansson or Natalie Portman, that’s the aim of what we’re doing,” Van der Velden told  the UK's Broadcast International.
If a talent agency signs the AI-generated actor, it would make Norwood one of the first to be represented by the talent agents that have always worked with flesh-and-blood actors.
What is the Backlash Against Tilly Norwood?
Multiple actors and directors have spoken out against the notion of a 100% AI actor.
"I don’t know how to quite answer it, other than to say how terrifying this is,” actor Emily Blunt told Variety.
She was then shown an image of Norwood.
“No, are you serious? That’s an AI?" she said. "Good Lord, we’re screwed. That is really, really scary. Come on, agencies, don’t do that. Please stop. Please stop taking away our human connection.”
"This is literally the mark of the end of the industry as we know it… say goodbye to actors," Oscar-nominated director Luca Guadagnino wrote on X. "No one should be supporting this."
Name-checking Johansson as an aspiration for Norwood may have been a particularly sensitive issue.
In 2024, Johansson said she hired legal counsel after claiming the company OpenAI, the creator of ChatGPT, used her voice's likeness without her consent for one of its new AI voice assistants.

Johansson's famously smoky voice was used in the 2013 science-fiction movie "Her" to power a fictionalized AI chatbot. OpenAI denied modeling the assistant after Johansson, but ultimately suspended using the voice.

The use of artificial intelligence by film studios was also a crucial bargaining point in the actors' strike in 2023. Actors, directors and other creators were concerned their likenesses or voices could be used in films, movies and other creations without their compensation or consent.
The SAG-AFTRA union weighed in with a statement after learning about Tilly Norwood.
"SAG-AFTRA believes creativity is, and should remain, human-centered," the union said. "The union is opposed to the replacement of human performers by synthetics.

“To be clear, 'Tilly Norwood” is not an actor, it’s a character generated by a computer program that was trained on the work of countless professional performers — without permission or compensation," the statement continued.

“It has no life experience to draw from, no emotion and, from what we’ve seen, audiences aren’t interested in watching computer-generated content untethered from the human experience. It doesn’t solve any ‘problem’ — it creates the problem of using stolen performances to put actors out of work, jeopardizing performer livelihoods and devaluing human artistry.”
How Has Tilly Norwood's Creator Responded to the Backlash?
Van der Velden responded with a lengthy statement shared on Sept. 28 on Instagram.

"To those who have expressed anger over the creation of my AI character, Tilly Norwood: she is not a replacement for a human being, but a creative work — a piece of art," she wrote. "Like many forms of art before her, she sparks conversation, and that in itself shows the power of creativity."

"I see AI not as a replacement for people, but as a new tool — a new paintbrush," she continued. "Just as animation, puppetry, or CGI opened fresh possibilities without taking away from live acting, AI offers another way to imagine and build stories. I'm an actor myself, and nothing — certainly not an AI character — can take away the craft or joy of human performance."

title: Matthew McConaughey and Kelly Clarkson Team Up for Surprise Duet
summary: Matthew McConaughey and Kelly Clarkson surprised fans with an impromptu duet on her talk show, performing his ZZ Top-inspired poem “Changing Lanes.”
story: This performance is more than just alright, alright, alright.

Kelly Clarkson and Matthew McConaughey joined forces on her talk show Sept. 30 to sing a poem the actor wrote set to the tune of ZZ Top’s 1972 track “Just Got Paid” that he came up with while on a road trip.
“You know that little chorus in ZZ Top’s ‘I just got paid today and got myself a pocketful of change?’” he said before humming the music.

“That meter — all of a sudden, lyrics and couplets started fitting into it. And on this road trip, I recorded them, got back and there was, like, 120 lines. And I was like, ‘Let’s look at this and see if any of it’s worth a damn.’ That one’s called ‘Changing Lanes.’”
“Changing Lanes” is one of the pieces included in his new book, “Poems & Prayers.”

“The Lost Bus” star then asked if Clarkson wanted to perform the song with him, prompting her to admit she knew about it, while pointing out her band on the set. The pair then walked over toward the band, which began playing.
The Oscar winner grabbed a microphone, while Clarkson stood to his right and worked as his backup singer as he performed his modified take on “Just Got Paid.”
“I said I just got paid today, I got myself a pocket full of change,” he began while Clarkson provided some soulful background help as he altered the lyrics of the original song.

“There’s no need to use my blinker now, no, when I’m changing lanes / Be best at what you’re good at, not better at what you’re not / So you can win again at what you want at before you go on fighting with what you fought.”
‘Cause if you shoot for an A and end up with a B it’s worth more than an F when you try to make a C,” he continued before a rocking guitar solo.

“And when more than you can imagine goes on and exceeds your expectation / well, go on, bet on it, believe that it is much more than just a vacation,” he continued. “When none of it matters no, and nothing, nothing is in vain / There’s no need to use your blinker then, not when you’re changing lanes.”
Clarkson then bowed toward McConaughey and clapped as the song wrapped up.
“Give it up for Matthew McConaughey, everybody!” she cheered as the audience howled.

title: 'Chinese Trump' wins fans and followers with his spot-on impersonation
summary: It’s unclear how soon President Donald Trump will visit China, but in the meantime, China has Ryan Chen.
story: CHONGQING, China — It’s unclear how soon President Donald Trump will visit China, but in the meantime, China has Ryan Chen.
His knack for impersonating Trump has turned Chen, 42, into a social media star, sweeping across Instagram and TikTok as the “Chinese Trump.”
“Guys, you know where we are? We’re in Chongqing, CHI-na!” Chen says in a typical video from his hometown, describing the city of more than 30 million people as “tremendous.”
It began last fall, when Chen posted a video on Chinese social media as a dare, complete with Trump’s rambling linguistic style and signature hand gestures.
“It went viral. I thought it was very good traffic,” Chen told NBC News recently in his first interview with a U.S. news organization. “So I started doing it ever since.”

After Trump’s re-election in November, Chen expanded his repertoire and reach by posting his impression videos on U.S. social media, with one clip showing him singing the global hit song “APT.” in a blond wig, a red tie and Trump’s voice.

He gained an even wider American viewership early this year when a looming U.S. ban on TikTok, the short-video app owned by the Chinese company ByteDance, triggered an influx of users to Chinese platforms such as RedNote, also known as Xiaohongshu.
Chen posted a series of videos welcoming the TikTok refugees and even taught them how to use Chinese slang, all while mimicking Trump.
“You sound just like him,” a California user commented on one of Chen’s RedNote posts. “But I came here to get away from him.”

As he gains popularity, Chen has been recorded with visitors from abroad, including Dana White, CEO of the Ultimate Fighting Championship, and American YouTube star IShowSpeed, who livestreamed his tour of China this year to his 44 million subscribers.
“I want people to view me as a bridge” between cultures, Chen said. “It’s a different perspective in a funny way.”

U.S.-China relations have been strained in Trump’s second term by an ongoing trade war, technological competition and differences over wars in Ukraine and the Middle East. Trump said last month after a phone call with Chinese President Xi Jinping that the two leaders would meet at the Oct. 31-Nov. 1 APEC summit in South Korea and that he would go to China early next year.

In a survey of the Chinese public published this month by the Chicago Council on Global Affairs and the Carter Center, only 17% of respondents said the United States was a friend to China — the lowest percentage of any country they were asked about — while 83% said it was not.

Chen, a former marketing manager who has never set foot in the United States, said he learned English on his own. He credits years of watching U.S. TV series, including the Trump-starring reality show “The Apprentice,” for his near-native accent.
“If you want to be good at doing him, you should watch the good imitators, because they kind of exaggerate his traits,” Chen said over a lunch of Chongqing noodles.
“If you were to rank me, I would not make top 10, but I’m the only Asian Trump and the only Chinese Trump. So that’s making me special!”
Leaving politics aside, Trump is a “funny guy” and an “entertainer,” he said.
“I like when he said: ‘You’re fired.’ It’s quite entertaining. I think his acting skills are so much better than mine.”

Chen watches the news to hone his technique, but he steers clear of anything political. In a country with many sensitivities and watchful censors, he prefers to use his platform to teach foreigners about Chinese food, travel and culture.
“I’m not interested in politics, actually,” Chen said. “The initial reason that I wanted to do Trump is because I think it’s funny. I want to make people laugh.”
His all but flawless impression of Trump has gained him millions of Chinese followers, some of whom stop him on the street to ask for selfies and advice about learning English.
Chen is increasingly recognized by people from outside China, as well.
“Oh, I think I know you, you’re the Trump,” Vadim Mitko, a 20-year-old from Russia, said when he encountered Chen on a Chongqing street.
“I was thinking, Chongqing is so far away from the USA, how is this guy speaking with that accent?” Mitko said of the videos he had seen on TikTok.
Chen, who is considering making his first trip to the United States, said that he had never thought about meeting Trump in person but that if he had the chance, he would tell Trump to visit China.
“You should come to Chongqing,” Chen said in Trump’s voice, to try the city’s famously spicy hotpot.
“You say you’re a tough guy,” he said. “Maybe you should try extra hot.”
Janis Mackey Frayer and Dawn Liu reported from Chongqing and Peter Guo from Hong Kong.

title: A-list comedians face backlash for performing at Saudi Arabian festival
summary: A comedy festival in the capital of Saudi Arabia has become a cultural flash point as major comedians face criticism for accepting seemingly lucrative deals to perform in a country that was virtually impossible to visit until 2019 and a pariah in much of the West for its human rights record
story: A comedy festival in the capital of Saudi Arabia has become a cultural flash point as major comedians face criticism for accepting seemingly lucrative deals to perform in a country that was virtually impossible to visit until 2019 and a pariah in much of the West for its human rights record.

The Riyadh Comedy Festival, which began Friday and runs through Oct. 9, features a variety of big names such as Dave Chappelle, Kevin Hart, Aziz Ansari, Pete Davidson, Andrew Schulz, Jo Koy, Bill Burr, Jessica Kirson, Jimmy Carr and Louis C.K.
These comedians, most of them American, are now encountering resistance from some fans, human rights advocates and fellow comics in the industry.
Marc Maron, host of the “WTF” podcast, blasted the festival in a recent stand-up clip, joking that it was easy for him to “take the high road on this one” considering he was not invited to perform.

“I mean, how do you even promote that?” Maron said. “Like, ‘From the folks that brought you 9/11, two weeks of laughter in the desert. Don’t miss it.’ I mean, the same guy that’s gonna pay them is the same guy that paid that guy to bone-saw Jamal Khashoggi and put him in a f---ing suitcase.”
The Saudi Embassy in Washington, D.C., declined to comment. Saudi Arabia’s General Entertainment Authority, which announced the festival in July, did not immediately respond to a request for comment.
